paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The chemo-naive BRCA2 mutant PDX #13 had a statistically significant response to both 300 and 450 mg kg−1 rucaparib, with median TTH of 81 days for rucaparib 300 mg kg−1 vs. 43 days for vehicle (p = 0.01, log-rank test, n = 9, 22), although regressions were not observed.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with resistance to PARPi.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in a patient-derived xenograft model.
key_quotes: The chemo-naive BRCA2 mutant PDX #13 had a statistically significant response to both 300 and 450 mg kg−1 rucaparib.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with sensitivity to PARPi.

variants.additional_notes: The variant was found in a patient-derived xenograft model.

tables_processed.table_caption: Responses observed in 12 HGSOC PDX to cisplatin and rucaparib treatment in vivo

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
